title: Wingate prepares investors for possible Ralan write-downs
text:
Non-bank lender Wingate has prepared investors in its $1 billion wholesale mortgage fund for possible writedowns due to its exposure to failed Sydney-based developer Ralan.

In its latest update to investors, Wingate said: "At the October meeting, with due regard to the uncertainties associated with the Ralan recovery process and as a matter of prudence, the WIP Valuation Committee recommended the creation of a 3¢ per unit general provision [to the $1 unit price] within the fund.

"Accordingly, with effect on 1 November, the ex-interest unit price will be 97¢. This is a general provision and not an impairment or permanent reduction in asset value."

Wingate part funded Ralan's The Orchid development in Sydney. Edwina Pickles

The Melbourne-based finance house and its high-net-worth investor base have the largest exposure of any creditor to the developer through senior and mezzanine debt funding. Wingate funded Ralan projects for more than a decade, before its sudden $500 million collapse at the end of July.

Wingate's mortgage lending is secured against numerous Ralan assets, including the $40 million Paradise Resort site on the Gold Coast and management rights to the completed Ruby One tower, both of which are in the hands of receivers and are on the market through selling agents.
description: As a matter of "prudence" Wingate recommended the creation of a 3¢ per unit general provision within its $1 billion mortgage fund.
